FuncDef: This command allows the configuration of WRED per queue with the following options:
CLIs: wred-queue [ policy <slope-policy-name> ] [ mode { native | pool-per-queue } ] [ slope-usage { default | exceed-low } ]

ParaDef.Info: Specifies an existing slope policy that is used to override the default WRED slope policy.

Specifies whether the WRED per queue is using the native FP3- and higher-based hardware WRED capabilities or pool per queue. Values-native - Each queue uses the hardware per queue WRED capabilities of the FP3- and higher-based hardware and requires slope-usage exceed-low.. ParamDefault: Default- native

Specifies the type of congestion control to be used. Values-default - Maps the inplus-profile, in-profile, out-of-profile, and exceed-profile traffic to the highplus, high, low, and exceed WRED slopes, respectively; this is only supported for pool-per-queue mode.. ParamDefault: Default- exceed-low
